elements.brief: Represents a renderable object (e.g. a single spri...
elements.description:
Represents a renderable object (e.g. a single sprite)
The renderer will (each frame) collect all entries with the current material tag, then batch these objects together.
Batching is done based on the batch key and Z value (or order for GUI nodes)
The caller will also register a callback function where the batched entries will be returned.
Each callback then represents a draw call, and will register a RenderObject
elements.name: RenderListEntry

parameters.doc: the world position of the object
parameters.name: m_WorldPosition

parameters.doc: the order to sort on (used if m_MajorOrder != RENDER_ORDER_WORLD)
parameters.name: m_Order

parameters.doc: the batch key to sort on (note: only 48 bits are currently used by renderer)
parameters.name: m_BatchKey

parameters.doc: the key to the list of material tags
parameters.name: m_TagListKey

parameters.doc: user data (available in the render dispatch callback)
parameters.name: m_UserData

parameters.doc: used to sort within a batch
parameters.name: m_MinorOrder

parameters.doc:
If RENDER_ORDER_WORLD, then sorting is done based on the world position.
Otherwise the sorting uses the m_Order value directly.
parameters.name: m_MajorOrder
